Question: Which Technology companies have shown the most consistent profitability improvement over the last 5 years (2019-2023)?
Business_context: Long-term profitability analysis for technology investment strategy and competitive positioning assessment
SQL_generated: WITH tech_companies AS (SELECT DISTINCT cik, name FROM companies WHERE LOWER(gics_sector) LIKE LOWER('%Technology%')), base_filings AS (SELECT s.adsh, s.cik, CAST(s.fy AS INTEGER) AS fiscal_year, s.period, s.filed, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY s.cik, s.fy ORDER BY s.filed DESC) AS rn FROM sub s JOIN tech_companies t USING (cik) WHERE s.form IN ('10-K','10-K/A') AND s.fy BETWEEN 2019 AND 2023), filings AS (SELECT adsh, cik, fiscal_year, period FROM base_filings WHERE rn = 1), values AS (SELECT f.cik, f.fiscal_year, MAX(CASE WHEN n.tag = 'NetIncomeLoss' THEN n.value END) AS net_income, MAX(CASE WHEN n.tag IN ('Revenues','RevenueFromContractWithCustomerExcludingAssessedTax','SalesRevenueNet') THEN n.value END) AS revenue FROM filings f JOIN num n ON f.adsh = n.adsh AND n.ddate = f.period WHERE n.tag IN ('NetIncomeLoss','Revenues','RevenueFromContractWithCustomerExcludingAssessedTax','SalesRevenueNet') GROUP BY f.cik, f.fiscal_year), margins AS (SELECT t.name, v.cik, v.fiscal_year, v.net_income / NULLIF(v.revenue, 0) AS profit_margin FROM values v JOIN tech_companies t ON v.cik = t.cik WHERE v.net_income IS NOT NULL AND v.revenue IS NOT NULL), ordered AS (SELECT m.*, LEAD(m.profit_margin) OVER (PARTITION BY m.cik ORDER BY m.fiscal_year) AS next_margin, LEAD(m.fiscal_year) OVER (PARTITION BY m.cik ORDER BY m.fiscal_year) AS next_year FROM margins m) SELECT name, ROUND(MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2019 THEN profit_margin END) * 100, 2) AS margin_2019_pct, ROUND(MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2020 THEN profit_margin END) * 100, 2) AS margin_2020_pct, ROUND(MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2021 THEN profit_margin END) * 100, 2) AS margin_2021_pct, ROUND(MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2022 THEN profit_margin END) * 100, 2) AS margin_2022_pct, ROUND(MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2023 THEN profit_margin END) * 100, 2) AS margin_2023_pct, ROUND((MAX(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2023 THEN profit_margin END) - MIN(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2019 THEN profit_margin END)) * 100, 2) AS improvement_pct, SUM(CASE WHEN next_year = fiscal_year + 1 AND next_margin IS NOT NULL AND next_margin >= profit_margin THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS consistency_steps FROM ordered GROUP BY name HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT fiscal_year) = 5 ORDER BY consistency_steps DESC, improvement_pct DESC, name LIMIT 5;
Visual_hint: Line chart showing profit margin trends

Question: Which companies across all sectors have shown the most significant debt reduction over the past 3 years (2021-2023), and what was the quarterly progression?
Business_context: Assess company deleveraging momentum in the post-pandemic recovery.
SQL_generated: WITH company_dim AS (SELECT cik, name, gics_sector FROM (SELECT cik, name, gics_sector, ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY cik ORDER BY name) AS rn FROM read_parquet('data/parquet/companies_with_sectors.parquet')) WHERE rn = 1), annual_filings AS (SELECT s.adsh, s.cik, CAST(s.fy AS INTEGER) AS fiscal_year, s.period FROM read_parquet('data/parquet/sub.parquet') s WHERE s.form IN ('10-K','10-K/A') AND s.fy BETWEEN 2021 AND 2023), debt_inputs AS (SELECT f.cik, f.fiscal_year, MAX(CASE WHEN n.tag IN ('DebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations','Totaldebtrecordeduponconsolidation') THEN n.value END) AS total_debt_tag, MAX(CASE WHEN n.tag IN ('LongTermDebt','LongTermDebtNoncurrent','LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations','LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligationsNoncurrent','UnsecuredLongTermDebt','LongTermDebtOfConsolidatedInvestmentProducts') THEN n.value END) AS long_term_debt, MAX(CASE WHEN n.tag IN ('DebtCurrent','ShortTermBorrowings','ShortTermBorrowingsIncludingLongTermDebtCurrent','ShortTermDebtAndCurrentPortionOfLongTermDebt','DebtAndCapitalLeaseObligationsCurrent') THEN n.value END) AS short_term_debt FROM annual_filings f JOIN read_parquet('data/parquet/num.parquet') n ON f.adsh = n.adsh AND n.ddate = f.period WHERE n.tag IN ('DebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations','Totaldebtrecordeduponconsolidation','LongTermDebt','LongTermDebtNoncurrent','LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligations','LongTermDebtAndCapitalLeaseObligationsNoncurrent','UnsecuredLongTermDebt','LongTermDebtOfConsolidatedInvestmentProducts','DebtCurrent','ShortTermBorrowings','ShortTermBorrowingsIncludingLongTermDebtCurrent','ShortTermDebtAndCurrentPortionOfLongTermDebt','DebtAndCapitalLeaseObligationsCurrent') GROUP BY f.cik, f.fiscal_year), total_debt AS (SELECT cik, fiscal_year, COALESCE(total_debt_tag, long_term_debt + COALESCE(short_term_debt, 0), long_term_debt, short_term_debt) AS total_debt FROM debt_inputs), ranked AS (SELECT td.cik, MIN(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2021 THEN total_debt END) AS debt_2021, MIN(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2022 THEN total_debt END) AS debt_2022, MIN(CASE WHEN fiscal_year = 2023 THEN total_debt END) AS debt_2023 FROM total_debt td GROUP BY td.cik HAVING COUNT(DISTINCT fiscal_year) = 3), joined AS (SELECT cd.name, cd.gics_sector, debt_2021, debt_2022, debt_2023, (debt_2021 - debt_2023) AS debt_reduction FROM ranked r JOIN company_dim cd USING (cik)) SELECT name, gics_sector, debt_2021, debt_2022, debt_2023, debt_reduction FROM joined WHERE debt_reduction > 0 ORDER BY debt_reduction DESC LIMIT 5;
Answer_expected: AT&T led with ~$40B reduction (22.6%), followed by AIG (-$29.9B, 99%), US Bancorp (-$29.1B, 65%), Deere (-$27.5B, 60%), and Apple (-$13.8B, 12.7%).
Visual_hint: Waterfall chart showing debt reduction progression
